header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends

body.u: I think we need to get this car insurance sorted out soon and need to get another quote

we do ah one thing that we need to do from ah change it to is erm put me as the main driver and increase the mileage up to erm nine thousand miles a year given that I will be doing a erm daily commute during most of the year
yes yes that's going to be significantly more than it's been doing in the past
yes it will a little bit of a shock
it will the car won't know what's happened
yes
so we'll have to try and give them a ring tomorrow
yes
and let them know that circumstances are going to change so
I expect it's going to be quite a bit dearer this time
well technically it will be the same price as last year but erm because we started erm at erm without not the full twelve months
mm yes
but this time you full amount
for the full year yes yes and a few extra miles won't it?
yes so technically you are getting a bit more for your money this time
yes yes
but obviously it's not as good as a a decrease in the price
no it isn't how are you finding driving the Polo?
it is a little bit different from what I was erm originally used to
yes
a learner car erm I think I've got used to it it does require a different style of driving
yes
I think you've got to remember you don't have as much power under your foot
no
and the steering is doesn't produce as much feedback and a little bit lighter
yes
the gears are approximately the same
yes
although the iif you were driving the A three erm you'd probably find that the eh gear stick is a little stiffer
oh right is it? yes
it's they think it's more feedback but
I see
I think some ways designing cars for it to feel good to the driver as well as a a practical point of view
mm yes yes do you think that you're more likely to buy the car that you learned to drive in in the future?
certainly that are similar
yes
ah I I was a a very good car really
mm
I think it was built to have very high standards
yes
and erm nice easy erm pleasurable to drive
yes
very sharp brakes
mm
erm quite a lot feedback on the steering and the gearbox
yes
I like the automatic handbrake
yes
I like that you don't have to take it off when you start erm the car
mm I think I might find that a bit difficult to get used to actually
well you'd if once you got used to it
yes
you would certainly miss it
yes
because for things like hill starts and when you're stopped at the traffic lights
yes
it definitely does make it a lot easier that you can just focus on putting it in gear one rather than having to release the handbrake from that type of thing
yes the handbrake yes
and also you know it's on it's either on or off you can't have partially have it on and then it rolls down a hill or something
yes no no no I think once you've got used to using a handbrake that it comes pretty automatically when you're driving you just do it without too much thought really
yes I think you find that I put the handbrake on a bit too stiff
yes I can't pull it can't release it when you put it on
do you think more cars will have automatic handbrakes in the future?
yes it is definitely something that is coming into you notice that with the erm Golf hire car
is that the way it's going? did that have it too?
yes
yes is it something that Audi have pioneered?
I think Vauxhall had it before Audi but I think each car company designed its own slightly different variation
did they really? yes
for example whilst Audi and VW are in the same group
mm
the VW erm automatic handbrake works differently to that of the Audi
oh I see
and that can be said a bit about different car manufacturers
yes
so all work slightly differently
mm
which is not such a good thing because the handbrake in a normal car it was really universal
yes it was
but obviously if you're fitting these automatic button handbrakes that slightly different
yes yes
it's not going to help it when people have to borrow a car or hire a car or change a car
yes yes that's right yeah that's true anyway we're going to have to have a little erm practice drive I think that the about the time that you would normally be leaving
yes
so that we get an idea of how long it's going to take you to get there
yes
bearing in mind that it could be very heavy traffic conditions
yes
which will probably take more time than we imagine
I think if the traffic is generally bad
mm
I don't know how many trials we're going to do
no
it might be worth considering the back route
yes
definitely when the weather is reasonable
in good weather that'll probably be quicker
yes
if it's icy though you'll have to stick to the main road I think
yes
cos that will be sure to be gritted I think
yes the that back road is unlikely to be
no
well gritted
it would be too dicey wouldn't it? iin this weather
be alright if you've got a four-by-four but
mm but we haven't
mm
yeah and then there's the question of whether it's better to get the parking permit or to park at the park-and-ride and get the shuttle bus for the last little bit
yes yes there's for and against with both really I think one good thing about the park-and-ride is there should be an abundance of space
mm yes
whereas I doubt that'll be guaranteed in the site parking
no that's it might get the parking permit get there and then find that all the spaces have gone and then you've got to go park it somewhere else anyway which might make you late
I know I know yes another thing about the er park-and-ride is there's usually so many spaces that it's really easy to get into them
mm yes yeah
whereas er if there's only one space left at the university and the person's parked slightly over or something that's going to be a bit hard to get in
yes I know sometimes it can be a bit tight that might be why it's left because it's a slightly narrower one
yeah whilst I think the Polo is capable of getting in narrower spaces it does make it more challenging to reverse it in and that sort of thing
yeah we don't want to put it to the test it sure does yeah mm if you could buy any car which car do you think you would like to choose? er which would you like the best?
if it was any car?
mm
erm I I think it would be a a high spec A three saloon
yes
yes I think the saloon does provide a bit more space than the the A three hatchback
yeah
but erm I think the saloons will be generally more expensive to buy
mm
which I'm not really looking for any additional expenditure
mm was the headroom quite good? because with you being quite tall you need quite a deep cabin to fit in comfortably don't you?
it was reasonable
yeah
the A three saloon might be more a bit more generous than the hatchback
yeah
yes but also I think erm a car that was smaller you'd struggle to have a fourth person in because the person behind the driver wouldn't have much legroom if I was using it
yes that's right because you have your seat pushed as far back as it can
yes
to get yourself in don't you?
because I can't reach the pedals with comfort if I'm not sat right
no that's right you've got long legs
my knees are hitting the
steering wheel?
yes
yeah
one disadvantage of that is that if you are to just conceal the it doesn't mean you have to really bend forward a bit
lean forward yes you can see any traffic coming
yes
yeah
but it's amazing what opportunities we're getting I mean some cars do erm side by side parking spaces automatically
really?
they take control of the steering wheel and do it themselves
that would be fantastic because that's one of the difficult manoeuvres isn't it?
yes
yes
yes and erm some of them have got erm cameras at the back and the front to help you
yes that would be good as well
that comes up on the erm it's off the entertainment system
oh I see yes
of course most medium to high-spec cars now come equipped with satnavs
yes already built in
yes
yes that's good isn't it?
erm most have telephones integrated as well
do they?
yes
like a mobile?
yes
sort of
so you don't have to install the hands-free equipment
no oh right amazing isn't it?

yes what's erm do you think we should try and erm get a a further potentially a further discount by trying to compete insurance companies with one another or do you think that we're going to struggle to achieve that considering that there's not that much difference between our current insurer and the cheapest?
erm no have you checked on the comparison websites?
yes the I think erm there's not going to be very much difference
no so you think we've more or less found the best deal that we can for the circumstances?
yes but also I think it's with a good insurer as well it's it's got quite good erm which recommended provider status well it's just lost it but it was very close
yes reviews? yes right yes
yes so it's sort of in the top four or five insurers
yes about yeah that's reassuring isn't it?
it is and also it's got the Yougov survey most erm assured
yeah reliable yeah why is it that some of the insurance companies are not on the comparison websites then and you've got to look up those separately

well they're trying their best not to have to lower their premiums as a result of erm comparison websites or they'll claim they're the cheapest so people will just think oh there's no point looking at comparison sites I'll just get a quote from there
oh I see the competition yeah mm I see
but generally some of them have been relatively competitive but not as good as the one
yes no
so having a union discount also helps

mm yeah it also makes it harder work for erm somebody who's looking for insurance that you've got to go on several different comparison websites and then these two or three other providers that you have to look up separately as well
it does yes
so it makes it a bit more long-winded
well to be honest the ah don't seem to be on comparison sites either
oh are they not on there?

I think they are but I think I do suspect sometimes with comparison sites is one way that they make their money is to try and erm sort of do it by a ranking of which insurer has paid them the most to try and sort of broker a bargain like that
yes really? bit convoluted isn't it?
yes
mm

but I think with the best providers or the ones that are top on the Which list I think if you get a quote from them it just gives you a different idea of what it costs to get some reasonable cover because I don't think you would want to go for one that is quite far down the list with maybe only forty percent quality score and customer service I just want somewhere that's nearer seventy-eightyish what the best ones are
mm yes no no satisfied yeah mm and it probably be best to pay it all in one lump is it rather than doing these
yes well they treat it more like a mortgage agreement rather than a erm like a if you know what I mean
mm

I think from your point of view you're seen as a pay-as-you-go pay one month then pay the next month but they seem to think it's a way to make another twenty percent eh margin by sort of dressing it up as a loan
yes yes oh right so you've got to pay for the of paying monthly yeah so we'll just do it all in one go and get it over with
yes mm yes some do offer it without additional charge but I don't think that is one of them
yes that is one of them no
eh I think that we should really just focus on getting the best price within the year I don't think it's worth paying extra just for the privilege of paying each month
yeah yeah no yes mm and something that's going to be different this time I mean I think when I get the tax renewal which happens near Christmas
yes
it's eh not going to have a tax disc any more is it?
I know I know
I'm surprised that's happened
it is it is it's it sort of marks the end of an era really
it does yeah they'll be collector's pieces now
yes
those tax discs
I've got some in my old toy post office
I know I used to give you them to play with in your post office so it was a good way though police for instance telling immediately whether or not your tax disc was in date
yes
but now presumably they'll have to look something up won't they? on their database?
mm well maybe with a like a scanner or something
yes
you know like just tap the registration plate and having said that I have noticed that on some of the roads we've been on there have been DVLA vans with cameras
right
erm obviously they must be checking for whether people have paid their tax or not so if they're using a camera I imagine they are using a database rather than the disc
yes
but I think in terms of something like an accident or erm what if erm a policeman's walking round on his duties it'll be easier to detect whether it's in date and whether it's been paid or not

mm well the last time I bought the tax disc at the post office I took my insurance and MOT certificate but the girl didn't look at them because once she'd put in my car registration number she could already tell whether the insurance was paid and up to date and whether the MOT was
yes
so that's already a step towards doing that
it is yes but also you can buy it online as well
yes
so that would be erm using that same technology
yes
I don't know whether they expect people buy tax discs online new digital ones or whether you can still buy them at the post office or what the arrangement is exactly
yes yeah I don't know we'll have to see when we get the renewal won't we? that's exactly what's going to happen

erm I don't know whether erm it will have its downsides I think it will possibly could be a little bit more bureaucratic in some ways because I don't think you know having these massive databases is perhaps not as simple as issuing the discs
mm
what do you think?
I have to say there's usually a downside isn't there?
yes or do you think people might think that they can get away with paying because there isn't any physical evidence of whether they've got it or not
I think that would be a bit dangerous really
yes
do you how much more time do you think I will need before I get a car of my own do you think? it will probably be at the next renewal or?
I don't know it's just finding the right car that you're interested in isn't it?
yes and crucially at the right price
at the right price definitely yeah will have to be quite a good value model car won't it?
yes I am personally hoping to get a an A three hatchback
I know
erm but the new model only came out two years ago
yes
so sort of this time next year we should start to see some reasonable ones on the second-hand markets
yes that people have had for a couple of years and are then going to buy another new one
yes yes but ah I think I would prefer to get the new model because I think it will age less
yes
because obviously the new model should be on the go for another well the old model was on the go for in excess of ten years
oh right
hopefully the new model will be so therefore it makes the car look newer which is they're still being produced
yeah yeah
but ah in some ways that is what you did with the Polo because erm
mm
you were one of their first new generation Polo owners
oh I was I was a real trailblazer
indeed
yeah I've liked it I've enjoyed driving it
yes still have made some use of it
and erm I'll be bumping up the mileage significantly
not literally I hope
yeah I'm sure you'll be a very safe driver
yes
yeah
I personally find driving on A roads a bit easier than B roads
mm yes
there's a I think one thing about B roads is you do worry about enough space for a big lorry to come and pass
yeah so tractors and things
yes but obviously you don't need to worry about that quite as much on an A road because the dual carriageway
yes it's more spacious isn't it?
yes obviously they are quite expensive to install and erm maintain if you a dual carriageway
yeah that's right
